item.title: Nifty and Sensex Close in Green: Market Wrap for December 11, 2025
item.description: Top News Nifty and Sensex Close in Green: Market Wrap for December 11, 2025 15 hours ago Indian stock markets ended positively on December 11, with Nifty 50 up 0.55% at 25,898.55 and Sensex rising 0.51% to 84,818.13. Market breadth was bullish with 2,597 advancing stocks out of 4,548 traded. Key buzzing stocks included InterGlobe Aviation, Biocon Biologics, and Kaynes Technology, driven by company-specific news and analyst actions.

item.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank Limited Schedules Investor Meeting at Citi India Financials Tour 2025
item.description: Kotak Mahindra Bank Limited Schedules Investor Meeting at Citi India Financials Tour 2025 8 hours ago Kotak Mahindra Bank Limited has scheduled an investor meeting for December 16, 2025, at the Citi India Financials Tour 2025 in Mumbai. The bank notified stock exchanges about this engagement with analysts and institutional investors as required under SEBI Regulation 30. The disclosure ensures transparency in investor relations activities and compliance with listing obligations.

item.title: Indrayani Biotech Reports Strong Q2FY26 Performance with Revenue Growth and Board Restructuring
item.description: Indrayani Biotech Reports Strong Q2FY26 Performance with Revenue Growth and Board Restructuring 11 hours ago Indrayani Biotech Limited announced Q2FY26 results showing consolidated revenue growth of 16.66% to ₹3,594.85 lakhs, while net profit decreased 25.04% to ₹91.21 lakhs. The company underwent significant governance changes with director resignation and committee reconstitution, and resolved regulatory compliance issues by paying BSE fines of ₹16,520.

item.title: Vidya Wires Limited Lists at ₹52.13 on BSE, Trades Above Issue Price
item.description: Vidya Wires Limited Lists at ₹52.13 on BSE, Trades Above Issue Price 1 day ago Vidya Wires Limited debuted on BSE at ₹52.13 per share, trading above its IPO issue price of ₹52.00. The listing reflects a modest premium of ₹0.13, representing approximately 0.25% gains over the offer price. The successful market debut enables regular trading of the company's shares on the exchange.
